tests.name: Blood count
tests.details: Blood count, laboratory test that determines the number of red blood cells (erythrocytes) and white blood cells (leukocytes) in a given volume of blood.

tests.name: Bone marrow aspiration
tests.details: Bone marrow aspiration, direct removal of a small amount (about 1â€“5 millilitres) of bone marrow by suction through a hollow needle.

tests.name: Kidney function test
tests.details: Kidney function test, any clinical and laboratory procedure designed to evaluate various aspects of renal (kidney) capacity and efficiency and to aid in the diagnosis of kidney disorders.

tests.name: Gastric fluid analysis
tests.details: Gastric fluid analysis, medical procedure used to examine the secretions and other liquid substances occurring in the stomach.

tests.name: Thyroid function test
tests.details: Thyroid function test, any laboratory procedure that assesses the production of the two active thyroid hormones, thyroxine (T4) and triiodothyronine (T3), by the thyroid gland and the production of thyrotropin (thyroid-stimulating hormone, TSH), the hormone that regulates thyroid secretion, by the pituitary gland.

tests.name: Urinalysis
tests.details: Urinalysis, laboratory examination of a sample of urine to obtain clinical information.

tests.name: Ultrasound
tests.details: Ultrasound, also called ultrasonography, in medicine, the use of high-frequency sound (ultrasonic) waves to produce images of structures within the human body.

tests.name: Nerve Conduction Velocity Test (NCV)
tests.details: A nerve conduction velocity test (NCV) is an electrical test that is used to determine the adequacy of the conduction of the nerve impulse as it courses down a nerve.

tests.name: Electrocardiogram
tests.details: The electrocardiogram (ECG or EKG) is a noninvasive test that is used to reflect underlying heart conditions by measuring the electrical activity of the heart.

tests.name: Complete Blood Count
tests.details: The complete blood count is the calculation of the cellular (formed elements) of blood. These calculations are generally determined by special machines that analyze the different components of blood in less than a minute.

tests.name: Full-body CT scan
tests.details: Full-body computed-tomography (CT) scans, which can cost $100, have been touted as a way to detect early signs of cancer and heart disease. But if you're healthy, they're of no proven benefit.

tests.name: Blood pressure check
tests.details: One in three adults in the U.S. has high blood pressure, a leading cause of heart attack, heart failure, stroke, kidney trouble, and vision loss.

tests.name: Cholesterol testing
tests.details: It's no secret that cholesterol that builds up in the blood vessels of the heart can trigger a heart attack - and the higher your level of low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol, the greater your risk.

tests.name: Radiation Therapy
tests.details: In radiation therapy (also called radiotherapy), invisible high-energy rays or beams of subatomic particles are used to damage cancer cells and can stop them from growing and dividing.
